div.head: Proposition 23
div.p: Subduing them first by war runs counter to the law, gentle yoke, light burden, and gentleness of Jesus Christ. Starting with war is in fact what Mohammad and the Romans did, with which they inquieted and robbed the world. It is what today the Turkish and Moorish do, and what the Sharif is now beginning to do. Therefore it is most iniquitous, tyrannical, infamous of the mellifluous name of Christ, and causative of infinite new blasphemies against the true God and against the Christian religion, as we have long experienced in the Indies. The Indians therefore think God to be the most cruel and most unjust and impious of any of the gods. As a result, war is an impediment to the conversion of any infidel. War has also rendered the conversion of infinite peoples in the New World an impossibility, besides all the irreparable and lamentable harms written in the eleventh proposition. Consequently, beginning evangelism by war is most clearly the infernal way.
